FacilityName: Dairy Farmers of America INC - Goshen

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Dry, Condensed, and Evaporated Dairy Product Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Dairy Farmers of America
Goshen, IN
Executive Summary

Facility Policy
Dairy Farmers of America located in Goshen, Indiana (DFA-Goshen) is committed to the protection of the safety, health, and environment in our routine operations and emergency responses. Our prevention and emergency response practices are developed to protect the public as well as our own employees. It is our policy to comply with applicable laws, and to support and work with local emergency response agencies.

DFA-Goshen has a refrigeration system which contains anhydrous ammonia (ammonia) in an amount greater than the threshold under the Risk Management Program (RMP) of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) according to Section 68 of Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations (40 CFR 68). The refrigeration system is designed and operated according to good engineering and sage work practices.

DFA-Goshen has established an Emergency Response Program that provides employee training on proper response procedures to an emergency in the event of a release. DFA-Goshen is coordinated with the Goshen Fire Department and the Elkhart County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).  DFA-Goshen has an excellent safety record in preventing and minimizing releases of ammonia.

Facility Information
The DFA-Goshen facility processes and packages dairy related products. DFA has on site an ammonia refrigeration system used to maintain product freshness, to meet processing requirements, and to provide cooling for employee comfort. DFA-Goshen is subject to the requirements of 40 CFR 68 because the refrigeration system contains more than the 10,000-pound threshold for ammonia, a regulated hazardous substance.

Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
DFA-Goshen has an accidental release prevention program to prevent and minimize the effects of a spill or release of ammonia. This program includes a training program for all operators and maintenance personnel, written mainten

ance and operating procedures, and a preventative maintenance program that includes regular inspections and tests of all equipment within the ammonia system.

Five-Year Accident History
In the past five years, there have been no accidental releases of ammonia as outlined in 40 CFR 68.42 .

Emergency Response Program
DFA-Goshen maintains a written Emergency Response Plan to help assure timely, safe, compliant responses in the event of an emergency. As stated previously, DFA-Goshen?s Emergency Response Program provides employee training on proper response procedures to an emergency in  the event of a release. DFA-Goshen is coordinated with the Goshen Fire Department and the Elkhart County LEPC.  In the event of a release, we would immediately notify our affected employees, the Goshen Fire Departments, the Elkhart County LEPC and initiate emergency shutdown procedures.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Safety improvements are an on-going process at this facility. Periodic inspections and evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe practices and operations. There are no additional specific regulated substance safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
